results.title: The Punter
results.brief_description: A short film about Jack Burnett and his involvment in the horse racing industry in the 1970s. (Jack is the father-in-law of the filmmaker) Identifiable with many students. Could be used for discussion on the idea of bought leisure and deals with gambling relating to horse racing.

results.title: The Puffed-up dragon (K)
results.brief_description: Combines delightfully animated paper cutouts and music to tell a story about a huge, hungry dragon who comes to a medieval kingdom and frightens the people because they do not know that he is a vegetarian.

results.title: The Public enemy
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and William Wellman
results.brief_description: James Cagney plays Tom Powers, the son of a Chicago policeman, growing up in the city slums where, as a boy, he naturally turns to petty crime as a way of life. As an adult he becomes a successful big-time liquor racketeer. Tom Power has no socially redeemimg traits. He takes pleasure in even the most petty of physical insults, such as grinding half a grapefruit into the startled face of Mae Clark. Cagney’s raw ferocious portrayal of a vicious criminal is masterful and the film is a classic in its genre. Also stars Jean Harlow and Joan Blondell.

results.title: The Public's business
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: Can a person in public office legitimately use his position for private gain? This question is couched in the language of a teenager as we sit on a committee of high school students planning refreshments for a forthcoming sports day. One boy, employed part-time by his caterer sells them on the idea of having his boss provide the eats. He later brags to a friend that he stands to profit on the deal. His friend objects on ethical grounds. Is he right in his objection?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Gudrun Parker

results.title: The Pub
results.brief_description:
Annabel spent the first 7 years of her life living above her parent’s pub. She reminisces about all the adventures had by her and her siblings as they run amok in their unconventional playground.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: The Psychologist and the experiment methodology (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An informative visual account of the standard methods which research experiments employ. Independent and dependent variables, control groups, random assignment to conditions and other basic statistical concepts are explored

results.title: The Psychic parrot
results.brief_description: A psychic parrot appears on television to announce that the world will end at midnight Friday. The President decides to send a rocket to the moon with a selected group of people on board so that the human race will survive. The build-up and drama in the days preceding the final events are dutifully reported by television and received by Henrietta (Alix Elias) and Fred (Michael Vale), stereotyped apartment dwellers who formulate their judgements while they experience life through television’s perceptual filter.

results.title: The Provincial connection
results.brief_description: Giancarlo came to Melbourne on board a ship in 1965 at the age of 15 and started work. By the age of 21 he had bought his first house. Giancarlo is now the president of the Ballarat Italian Association and celebrates “the positive contribution of Italians to Australia”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: The Prospector
results.creator_credit: Children's Library and Crafts Movement Australiaz and Daryl Hill
results.brief_description: A man who has been “panning” for gold all his life in the vicinity of the Hill End goldfields gives an account of how the fossicking is actually done, and gives something of the history of Hill End itself.
